name: clinched
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
clinch
clinch verb
(WIN)
[ T ] to finally get or win something: I hear he finally clinched the deal to buy the land he wanted.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Getting, receiving and accepting
clinch verb
(DECIDE)
clinch it
to make someone decide what to do after a lot of thought or discussion: When they said the job would involve travelling to Paris, that clinched it (for her) (= that made her certain that she wanted the job).
